content.title: Intro
content.content:
1909

1909
1910
Year
1911

1911

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1910.

content.title: January
content.content: 1 - An entry is written by J.R.R. Tolkien in the first of his preserved diaries.

content.title: April
content.content: ? - J.R.R. Tolkien sees Peter Pan at a Birmingham theatre, about which he writes in his diary.

content.title: May
content.content: ? - J.R.R. Tolkien writes the poem The Dale-lands.

content.title: November
content.content:
1 - J.R.R. Tolkien visits Cambridge for a football match.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien writes the "Debating Society Report" in King Edward's School Chronicle.

content.title: December
content.content:
17 - J.R.R. Tolkien is awarded an Open Classical Exhibition for classical languages to Exeter College.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien writes the "Debating Society Report" in King Edward's School Chronicle.

? - Father Morgan moves the boys.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien is forbidden from contacting Edith Bratt until he is twenty-one. She leaves for Birmingham.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien speaks Gothic and Old English in a school debate.
Years
1907 1908 1909 1910 1911 1912 1913
